description:
URL Assist is a new tool for webOS that allows you to register apps to handle URLs anywhere in the system. Originally built for MeTube, to allow it to launch when you tap a YouTube link, it also has a custom mode that can allow you to register other apps that support the 'target' launch parameter. Once configured, anywhere you tap on a configured link in webOS, an app will launch, instead of the old webOS Browser. Read more about the functionality in the Luna Service Reference Documentation at sdk.webosarchive.org.

For Leo.
versionNote:
1.0.0 - Re-release. Tested on Pre Plus, Pre 2, Pre 3 Emulator, Touchpad.
1.1.0 - Adds support for YouTube Mobile links
